field_reports.description: On August 31, 2024, the Karma rainy season was marked by extreme precipitation, with 85 mm of water falling in the space of a few hours. This event, accompanied by strong winds, particularly affected the capital and the coastal region of Tadjourah. The city's neighborhoods were flooded, roofs blown off, and many homes severely damaged. Roads were flooded, the seafront was eroded, and power poles and stores were badly damaged. State infrastructures, runways, hospitals and telephone networks were also heavily impacted.

results.name: DJI: Other - 08-2024 - Heavy wind/rain

field_reports.description: The Tadjourah Branch of Djibouti Red Crescent has reported that at the 22nd of July, in Malaho at the North-west of Tadjourah region, an event of heavy winds with rain has occured affecting the locality. A lightening has also been struck, killing one individual and causing severe injuries to the rest of the family who had been admitted to the nearest hospital in the area.

results.name: DJI: Other - 07-2024 - lightening
results.summary: The Tadjourah Branch of Djibouti Red Crescent has reported that at the 22nd of July, in Malaho at the North-west of Tadjourah region, an event of heavy winds with rain has occured affecting the locality. A lightening has also been struck, killing one individual and causing severe injuries to the rest of the family who had been admitted to the nearest hospital in the area.

field_reports.description: According to the coordinator of the Dikhil branch, volunteers in the Sankal area of southwestern Djibouti reported a dry storm and lightning striking a camp for displaced people at 11pm on July 21st. This incident resulted in the tragic deaths of a mother and a 2-year-old boy from one family, and left another child seriously injured.

results.name: DJI: Other - 07-2024 - lightening
results.summary: According to the coordinator of the Dikhil branch, volunteers in the Sankal area of southwestern Djibouti reported a dry storm and lightning striking a camp for displaced people at 11pm on July 21st. field_reports.description:
At the 23 April , it has been reported by the Obock branch of the Red Crescent, the boat was on its journey from Yemen to the Djiboutian coast. The tragic incident occurred in Godoria, approximately 30 kilometers away from the main town of Obock, resulting in the loss of 21 lives, among them 4 women and 1 child. 32 individuals managed to survive, while over twenty others still missing on the 77 on board.

Djibouti stands as one of the most traversed migratory paths in the Horn of Africa, acting as a transit point for migrants traveling to and from the Arabian Peninsula via the Obock region.

This marks the second such accident within a span of weeks during this April, bringing the total number of fatalities to nearly sixty, with approximately thirty individuals still missing.
field_reports.summary: DJI: Transport Accident - 04-2024 - Migrant boat capsize

results.name: DJI: Transport Accident - 04-2024 - Migrant boat capsize

field_reports.description:
In recent years, human activities on the environment (the cutting of firewood and coal, bricks and housing construction, which has had a negative impact on the environment and has led to climate change, with the consequence of these series of damages that we are witnessing today)Today with the wind blowing over some localities without barriers.

After these series of events, several very significant human and material damage were recorded. These affected families have remained mostly homeless, some families in mourning, others continue the treatment of their wounds, and live with host families for some, sleep under the stars and others in schools.

Pour les prévisions saisonnières OND 2023, il a été annoncé par ICPAC une pluviométrie au-delà du seuil normal dans toute la region de l'Afrique de l'Est. L'ANM a porté à l'intention du public l' avenement des pluies forts ainsi la dernière semaine d’Octobre (26 et 27) ,Djibouti et ses regions decentralisées tels que Arta, Ali Sabieh, Tadjourah, ainsi qu’Obock ont expérimenté les fortes pluies intermittentes  accompagnées des vents. Les effets se sont traduites par l'inondation des habitations , la stagnation des eaux dans les surfaces des maisons ainsi que dans les espaces publics (routes, ecoles, marchés)  favorisant la proliferation des larves et des moustiques. Avec cette saison fraiche, toute accumulation de pluie importante dans les zones or et déjà inondés pourrait s'annoncer très mal et defavorable pour les personnes vivant dans les zones à risques; les poussant à se déplacer, perdant leur abris et l'accès à l'eau potable et la sanitation. 

Toutefois l’alerte est toujours d’actualité et les prévisions sont surveillées de très près.
field_reports.summary: DJI: Inondation - 10-2023 - forte pluie et vent violent lié au phénomène El Nino 2023

results.name: DJI: Flood - 10-2023 - heavy rain and strong wind linked to the El Nino phenomenon 2023
results.summary:
For the OND 2023 seasonal forecast, it was announced by ICPAC that rainfall is above normal in the entire East African region. The ANM brought to the public the advent of heavy rains so in the last week of October (26 and 27), Djibouti and its decentralized regions such as Arta, Ali Sabieh, Tadjourah, as well as Obock experienced intermittent  heavy rains accompanied by winds. Theeffects have resulted in the flooding of homes, the stagnation of water in the surfaces of houses as well as in public spaces (roads, schools, markets)  favoring the proliferation of larvae and mosquitoes. With this cool season, any significant accumulation of rain in the gold and already flooded areas could look very bad and unfavorable for people living in the areas at risk; pushing them to move, losing their shelter and access to drinking water and sanitation. 

However, the alert is still relevant and the forecasts are being monitored very closely.

field_reports.description:
The town of Obock and its outlying areas are experiencing an unprecedented surge in migrants, who are piling up by the thousands.  The strong presence and, above all, the considerable increase in the number of migrants in Obock is due to the closure of the borders by the Yemenis on the other side of the Red Sea.
As a result, the interior of Obock's districts, the beaches and especially the Fanteherou area, a popular district which is the last and main gathering place for migrants before crossing to Yemen, remain flooded with them. 
All the watering places are overflowing. These migrants share the same environmental space as the host population. As a result, the first cases of acute diarrhoea appeared among the migrant population in the Fanteherou district. 
Initially, at wednesday 18th October 9 cases were detected among the migrant population, but in the same afternoon this number rose to 18. The next day was counted  33 case were recorded and one dead person. 
The local health authorities declared an epidemic of acute diarrhoea in the town of Obock on the morning of Wednesday October 18, and a care and treatment center has been set up in the main courtyard of the Obock medical-hospital center to receive patients suffering from the epidemic.
So far 33 cases have been recorded, all from the migrant population. The host population is unaffected, but the situation is likely to worsen with the onset of the cool season if measures are not taken.

results.name: DJI: Epidemic - 2023-10 - acute diarrhea
results.summary:
The town of Obock and its outlying areas are experiencing an unprecedented surge in migrants, who are piling up by the thousands.  The strong presence and, above all, the considerable increase in the number of migrants in Obock is due to the closure of the borders by the Yemenis on the other side of the Red Sea.

All the watering places are overflowing. These migrants share the same environmental space as the host population. As a result, the first cases of acute diarrhoea appeared among the migrant population in the Fanteherou district. 
Initially, at wednesday 18th October 9 cases were detected among the migrant population, but in the same afternoon this number rose to 18. The next day was counted  33 case were recorded and one dead person. 
The local health authorities declared an epidemic of acute diarrhoea in the town of Obock on the morning of Wednesday October 18, and a care and treatment center has been set up in the main courtyard of the Obock medical-hospital center to receive patients suffering from the epidemic.

field_reports.description:
The Geophysical Observatory of Arta recorded on September 28, 2023, a series of tremors, the largest of which was strongly felt in Djibouti as well as in the regions occurred around 04: 22 and had a magnitude of 5.2 degrees on the Richter scale. Other tremors were also recorded during the day but these were of lesser intensity (less than or equal to 3). The epicenter of seism was recorded 19 km from the Gulf of Tadjourah with a depth of 9 km.  

According to authorities, no casualties were reported. But as a preventive measure related to the risks of repliques, schools and vocational training centers have been closed and safety instructions on the actions to adopt have been communicated on media channels to notify the population.

results.name: DJI: Earthquake - 2023-09 - Earthquake
results.summary:
The Geophysical Observatory of Arta recorded on September 28, 2023, a series of tremors, the largest of which was strongly felt in Djibouti as well as in the regions occurred around 04: 22 and had a magnitude of 5.2 degrees on the Richter scale. Other tremors were also recorded during the day but these were of lesser intensity (less than or equal to 3). The epicenter of seism was recorded 19 km from the Gulf of Tadjourah with a depth of 9 km.  

According to authorities, no casualties were reported. But as a preventive measure related to the risks of repliques, schools and vocational training centers have been closed and safety instructions on the actions to adopt have been communicated on media channels to notify the population.

field_reports.description:
Dans les soirées de samedi 10 juin et dimanche 12 juin 2023, 2 localités (Omar Jagaa et Sankal) situées respectivement dans les régions administratifs d’Arta et de Dikhil de la république de Djibouti ont été touchées par des vents violents accompagnées des averses sporadiques.  Ces deux localités affectées, sont des zones habitées par des personnes déplacées internes particulièrement vulnérables.  

Cet événement naturel lié au changement climatique a été qualifié par la communauté locale comme étant sans précédent de par sa violence et sa spontanéité. D’où une certaine frayeur qui reste perceptible.

Les branches régionales du Croissant Rouge de Djibouti ainsi que les autorités publiques locales ont entrepris des missions d’évaluations post catastrophes  pour évaluer l’ampleur des dégâts causés par cet événement.

Aucune perte de vie humaine n'est à deplorer. L'essentiel des degats se limitent à la destruction des habitats, les latrines ainsi que les matériels de stockage d'eau. En raison de leur faible ressources fianancières les habitats sont construits à base des materiaux de fortune. 

Au  total, les nombres des ménages sinistrés s’élèvent à 128. Soient 768 personnes selon la taille moyenne du ménage à Djibouti qui est du 6 personnes.

results.name: DJI: Cyclone - 2023-06 - High Winds/Rain
results.summary:
On the evenings of Saturday, June 10 and Sunday, June 12, 2023, 2 localities (Omar Jagaa and Sankal) located respectively in the administrative regions of Arta and Dikhil of the Republic of Djibouti were affected by strong winds accompanied by sporadic showers.  These two affected localities are areas inhabited by particularly vulnerable internally displaced persons.  

This natural event linked to climate change has been described by the local community as unprecedented in its violence and spontaneity. Hence a certain fear that remains perceptible.

The regional branches of the Djibouti Red Crescent Society and local public authorities have undertaken post-disaster  assessment missions to assess the extent of the damage caused by this event.

No loss of human life was reported. Most of the damage is limited to the destruction of habitats, latrines and water storage equipment. Due to their limited financial resources, the settlements are built from makeshift materials. 

In  total, the number of affected households is 128. That is 768 people according to the average household size in Djibouti which is 6 people.

appeals.sector: Country cluster for Ethiopia and Djibouti

field_reports.description: Alors que les acteurs humanitaires se penchaient sur la réponse à donner sur la crise d'insécurité alimentaire causé par la sécheresse, l'arrivée des premières pluies donnent un nouveau développement à la crise suite aux inondations qui compliquent davantage les vulnérabilités des communautés affectées

results.name: DJI: Rain/Flash Flood - 2022-08 - Djibouti flood
results.summary: While humanitarian actors were looking at the response to the food insecurity crisis caused by the drought, the arrival of the first rains gives a new development to the crisis following the floods which further complicate the vulnerabilities of the affected communities

appeals.sector: Country cluster for Ethiopia and Djibouti

field_reports.description:
CYCLONE TROPICAL GATI 
Le violent cyclone «GATI» de catégorie 3 a touché les côtes Somaliennes
«Puntland»  hier soir vers 20h :CAP CARDAFUI, ALULA, HAFOUN, BARGAAL et ses
alentours provoquant des pertes de vies et des lourds dégâts matériels.

Il est très susceptible de se déplacer vers l'ouest tout au long de la mer de
Somaliland et de s’affaiblir petit à petit en une profonde dépression au cours des
3 prochaines heures en une dépression au cours des 6 heures à venir.

Les amas nuageux du résidu atteindront sur nos régions côtières à partir du
mardi 24 Novembre 2020.

Il est très probable que des faibles averses intermittentes se produisent sur nos
côtes maritimes y compris Djibouti-ville en fin de nuit du mardi et en début
mâtinée du Mercredi 25 Novembre 2020.
